Package io.frictionlessdata.tableschema.schema

Class Schema

java.lang.Object
io.frictionlessdata.tableschema.schema.Schema
Direct Known Subclasses:
BeanSchema
public class Schema extends Object
This class implements the Table Schema specification from https://specs.frictionlessdata.io//table-schema/index.html Table Schema is a simple language- and implementation-agnostic way to declare a schema for tabular data. Table Schema is well suited for use cases around handling and validating tabular data in text formats such as CSV, but its utility extends well beyond this core usage, towards a range of applications where data benefits from a portable schema format This class is the Java implementation of a Table Schema. It makes a semantic difference between:
  • constructing a Schema from scratch (e.g. empty or from a Collection of Fields)
  • the various overloaded `fromSource()` methods that read a Schema from a URL or File or InputStream.
  • guessing a Schema from a sample of data ("inferring" a Schema), the `infer()` methods
Schemas can be serialized to File or OutputStream via the `writeJson()` Methods. The seriolized form can be used to re-create a schema via the `fromSource()` method.

    • infer

      public static Schema infer(List<Object[]> data, String[] headers) throws TypeInferringException, IOException
      Infer the data types and return the generated schema.
      Parameters:
      data - a List of table rows
      headers - the table headers
      Returns:
      Schema generated from the inferred input
      Throws:
      TypeInferringException - if inferring of the Schema fails
      IOException

    • infer

      public static Schema infer(List<Object[]> data, String[] headers, int rowLimit) throws TypeInferringException, IOException
      Infer the data types and return the generated schema.
      Parameters:
      data - a List of table rows
      headers - the table headers
      rowLimit - maximal number of rows to use for Schema inferral
      Returns:
      Schema generated from the inferred input
      Throws:
      TypeInferringException - if inferring of the Schema fails
      IOException - if an underlying IOException is thrown

      Throws:

      Throws:

    • addForeignKey

      public void addForeignKey(ForeignKey foreignKey)

    • similar

      public boolean similar(Schema other)
      Similar to equals(Object), but disregards the `format` property to allow for Schemas that are similar except that Fields have no defined format. Also treats null and empty string the same for `name` and `type`.
      Parameters:
      other - the Field to compare against
      Returns:
      true if the other Field is equals ignoring the format, false otherwise

    • equals

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object

    • validate

      public void validate() throws ValidationException
      Validate the loaded Schema. First do a formal validation via JSON schema, then check foreign keys match to existing fields.

      Validation is strict or lenient depending on how the package was instantiated with the strict flag.

      Throws:
      ValidationException - If validation fails and validation is strict
